item.name: 4th Dimension
item.comment: I used to have the original UK version, which had better pieces, IMHO. Actually I still have the very original version, with cardboard counters rather than physical pieces. And recently recovered my original plastic pieces version complete with strategy guide!

item.name: Ace of Aces: Handy Rotary Series
Around the World in 80 Days
item.comment: Nice balance of choices with small chance element. Very nice components, has tremendous potential. Even has a little "screw you" and die rolls. Something for everyone.

item.name: The Awful Green Things From Outer Space
item.comment: I have both the original "wrap-around" TSR version and the more recent SJG version. The TSR original is vastly superior to the very cheaply produced SJG version.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: Good game, but broken for two players. Unless you reduce the size of the board... like Travel Blokus!!!

item.name: Classic Warlord
item.comment: My copy is the GW Apocalypse version. I played Warlord several times around '78-'82 and loved it. Wish I had one.

item.name: Gemblo
item.comment: Have the travel version Gemblo Light, too.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment: Even better than I expected. Simply terriffic!

item.name: The Hobbit: The Defeat of Smaug
Ingenious
item.comment: Lost track of how many times we've played this classic. Fantastic game.

item.name: Jenseits von Theben
item.conditiontext: What a great game! Finally got to play a 2-player game, looking forward to getting more players!

item.name: Keythedral
item.comment: Finally got to play this! Might edge of Settlers soon as one of my favourites! Worked well with 2 players, would like to see it with 3 or 4.

item.name: Kingmaker
item.comment: I have at leat 4 copies of this! The original Ariel/Philmar version, 2 of the 1st AH version and one of the later AH versions.

item.name: The Legend of Landlock
item.comment: I have lots of fun playing this with my seven year old daughter.

item.name: Ogre
item.comment: Played this game to death in the 80s. Have multiple copies including the Deluxe Ogre (miniatures) and the original 1st Edition.

item.name: Once upon a Time in the West
item.comment: Always fun at conventions, was very easy for casual gamers to pick up. Helped play test it, back in the day...

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: I have the Audi edition.

item.name: Pony Wars, Miniature rules
item.comment: Another favourite that I was lucky enough to help play test. Fun, fun game, easy to pick up.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: Finally got to play a complete game. It is actually superb, but with a horrible rulebook. Still, I would play it again no question.

item.name: Quinamid
item.comment: Played my first games against my wife, who beat me soundly! I think I won 3 out of 12! Lots of strategy although the starting moves seems to be consistent (racing for the 2x2 topmost tile). Probably more fun than Pentago over the long run, more on tht later.

item.name: Return of: Once Upon a Time in the West
Rudis
item.comment: I helped play test this a long time ago, as part of Halifax Wargames Society. Ian is greatly missed.

item.name: Seismic
item.comment: Nice cross between Carcassonne and Metro! I like it!

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Fishermen of Catan
The Settlers of the Stone Age
Thurn and Taxis
item.comment: Fantastic game, not surprising it won SdJ.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Actually have played this about 150 times or so. Lost count!

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Märklin
item.comment: Best of the three, IMHO.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
Wings of War: Watch Your Back!
